g.text: perovskite can withstand constant exposure of moisture for one year in ambient.

clusters periodically arranged in the crystallographic “c” axis separated by 0.5 nm

intensity of emission. In the work [

single crystals with zero-dimensional cluster structure was reported.
This structure represents two kinds of octahedra with di
erent distortions. Such NCs were synthesized
in a Teﬂon-lined stainless-steel autoclave, and they emit at 437 nm with a PLQY more than 28%.

octahedra on the surface, which formed an inorganic protective BiOCl shell.
Another good candidate for lead atomsubstitution in the perovskite materials is indium. In the
], a hydrothermal synthesis of zero-dimensional indium-based Cs
with emission in red spectral region with PLQY of 33%was reported. The strong PL emission is due to
self-trapping excitons, which are the result of structural deformation in an excited state. The transition
O and the dehydrated form is accompanied by a switchable double

Herein, we discuss some nontypical chemical elements that are used in lead-free perovskites.
